input_str:
Chevron vowed to 'fight until hell freezes over and then fight it out on the ice' before it remedied its Ecuadorian oil pollution disaster — but only now has evidence emerged to show just how dirty it has been fighting, writes Mike Gaworecki from De Smog Blog.

Chevron has already lost the lawsuit filed against the company by a group of Indigenous villagers and rural Ecuadorians who say Texaco, which merged with Chevron in 2001, left behind hundreds of open, unlined pits full of toxic oil waste
